intro: Stylidium sulcatum, commonly known as the zigzag lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Haemodoraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive zigzag-shaped stems. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands and heathlands. Stylidium sulcatum is a short-lived annual plant, typically reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
